title: PWBC Tri-County FOIA Project: Residential Water Data (Clerk)
tags: people’s water board coalition first requests

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: PWBC Tri-County FOIA Project: Residential Water Data (Clerk)
communications.communication:
Dear Records Custodian,

This is a request under the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (MCL 15.231 et. seq.) for documents that detail how your community’s water system functions, including details on utility terminations, restorations, and rates.

As context for this request, I am requesting these records on behalf of the People’s Water Board Coalition, a non-profit organization that advocates for equitable access, protection, and affordability of utility services, and water conservation. We are filing similar requests for information with many other Michigan water utilities in collaboration with residents, community leaders, and local officials to better support the needs of low-income customers. If any of this information is publicly available and accessible, please send a link to the webpage where it is located. Please reply to this request via email. If you have any question or concern about this request, please call Cass Charrette at 248-980-1191.

When possible, please provide the requested quantitative data in an Excel spreadsheet or other native digital format (such as CSV files). 

1. A copy of any data and documents that list the addresses and dates of residential customers that have had their water service terminated starting January 1, 2019 to date of the submission of the FOIA, the reason for the termination, and the amount of arrears for each account. If this data is produced in another format, such as written logs or summary reports, please provide a copy of that instead. If your agency has a policy that home address information is exempt from FOIA, please provide this data at the street level. 

2. Any documents describing and listing the addresses and dates of residential customers that have had their water service restored starting January 1, 2019 to date of submission of the FOIA, following a disconnection. If this data is included in the same data set as Item 6, you may provide that full data set in lieu of processing this element separately.

3. A copy of any existing, regularly generated reports that include the total amount of water and wastewater customer arrearages, number of customers in arrears, and median amount of arrearages per customer, and number of customers subject to potential service disconnection due to arrears by customer class (e.g., residential, non-profit, commercial, industrial) starting January 1, 2019 to date of submission of the FOIA. 

4. A copy of a list of referrals the utility/water system/municipality sent to the tax assessor to place a tax lien on properties due to non-payment of any water or sewer bill, starting January 1, 2019 to date of submission of the FOIA, and the amount of arrears for each account. If this information is stored in a summary database, you may provide that database.

5. Any documents describing or listing the addresses of residential customer accounts that have been enrolled in and have been discharged from the Great Lakes Water Authority’s Water Residential Assistance Program, and the reason for such removal or discharge, starting January 1, 2019 to date of submission of the FOIA. 

As I am requesting these records as a representative of People’s Water Board Coalition, a non-profit organization, and am doing so in the public interest, I request a waiver of fees. The analysis and release of these materials will contribute significantly to public understanding of water affordability issues in the tri-county area. 

I will expect a response within 5 business days as provided by law. If my request is denied in whole or in part, I expect a detailed justification for withholding the records. I also request any segregable portions that are not exempt to be disclosed.

If you have any questions or suggestions for reducing the burden of my request, please reach out and we are happy to discuss.

Sincerely,
People’s Water Board Coalition

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: PWBC Tri-County FOIA Project: Residential Water Data (Clerk)
communications.communication:
Good morning,

I am in receipt of your FOIA request.  Per the FOIA Act here in the State of Michigan, I do have the legal right to request a deposit before work can begin on your request.  At this time I am requesting a deposit of $100.00, made payable to the Village of Romeo, be received before researching your request.

If you have any further questions or concerns, please contact me.

Thank you,
Kathryn Trapp

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: PWBC Tri-County FOIA Project: Residential Water Data (Clerk)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, Ms. Trapp.

I am in receipt of your request for a deposit of $100 to be paid before proceeding with the FOIA research and am prepared to pay it.

However, I need an estimate of:
a) how much the total work will likely cost;
b) with the deposit alone, how much research can be accomplished and what data can be provided from it.

As a small community-based, non-profit organization working for the benefit of low-income residents, we are working with a very small budget and ask for any assistance you can offer with that in mind.

Thanks very much,
Sylvia Orduño
PWBC

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: PWBC Tri-County FOIA Project: Residential Water Data (Clerk)
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Your FOIA request is a lengthy one.  It would involve and multiple departments to address all of your concerns.  Also, due involvement of multiple departments it is difficult to determine the amount of hours involved at this time.  The hourly rate for Labor is $16.00, and .25 cents per page, either copied on paper or delivered electronically.

Thank you,
Kathryn Trapp

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: PWBC Tri-County FOIA Project: Residential Water Data (Clerk)
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Trapp,

Thanks very much for your reply. I apologize for the late response. We have restarted this FOIA project and I will follow up with the fee immediately after this.

We look forward to learning what you discover with this deposit for work to begin, including current data as of this date.

Sincerely,
Sylvia Orduño
People's Water Board Coalition

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: PWBC Tri-County FOIA Project: Residential Water Data (Clerk)
communications.communication:
Dear Records Custodian,

This is a request under the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (MCL 15.231 et. seq.) for documents that detail how your community’s water system functions, including details on collection practices and rates.

As context for this request, I am requesting these records on behalf of the People’s Water Board Coalition, a non-profit organization that advocates for equitable access, protection, and affordability of utility services, and water conservation. We are filing similar requests for information with many other Michigan water utilities in collaboration with residents, community leaders, and local officials to better support the needs of low-income customers. If any of this information is publicly available and accessible, please send a link to the webpage where it is located. Please reply to this request via email. If you have any question or concern about this request, please call Cass Charrette at 248-980-1191.

When possible, please provide the requested quantitative data in an Excel spreadsheet or other native digital format (such as CSV files).

(1) Collection Practices: Any documents describing policies, procedures, and standard operating procedures (SOPs) regarding:
a. Water arrearages, and
b. Shutoffs,
c. Liens, including temporary policies and procedures for customers of the utility/water system/municipality (i.e., delinquency amount that triggers water service shut-off notice and lien, seasonal and short-term and temporary suspensions of disconnections).
d. Please include these policies covering both:
- residential customers and
- non-residential customers.

2. Customer Charges: The most current documents describing:
a. Rates, charges, and user fees for
- water,
- wastewater and
- stormwater service for the utility/water system/municipality,
b. Definitions of customer category distinctions for water, wastewater and stormwater service:
- Residential (single-family vs. multi-family),
- Nonresidential (e.g, commercial, industrial, Nonprofit)
c. Any written procedures the process used for:
- approving new rates,
- the legal authority for approving the rates.
- what stakeholder is the advisory decision maker for the city related to water customer rates and charges

3. Water Assistance Programs, Affordability Programs, and/or Payment Plans: Any documents describing:
a. Water service affordability or assistance programs offered by the utility/water system/municipality and communicated to residential customers of the utility/water system/municipality
- Describe the benefit level
- Eligibility criteria
- Enrollment process
- Funding source
- Program cost
b. Names of any other state, county and local assistance programs the utility/water system/municipality refers to its customers:
- State assistance programs,
- County assistance programs, and
- Local assistance programs
c. Information about how assistance or affordability programs are communicated or markets to residential customers:
- Where it is marketed; and
- How it is marketed to customers;
d. Outreach materials:
- Template letters used for such outreach or marketing
- Pamphlets
- Phone scripts, and
- Other materials distributed to residents inquiring about assistance.
e. Enrollment and utilization statistics
- Customers enrolled in calendar year
- Payment amount
f. Payment plan information
- Details of program - term
- Enrollment

4. Federal Funding: Any documents, including budgets, describing the use of ARPA and other federal relief funds for
a. water arrearages,
b. lead service line replacements, and
c. other water programs.

5. Customer Service Issues. Any documents, policies and procedures describing
a. Customer service or billing dispute processes (e.g., how can a customer dispute a bill or payment plan denial?), and
b. Appeals process for billing decisions.

As I am requesting these records as a representative of People’s Water Board Coalition, a non-profit organization, and am doing so in the public interest, I request a waiver of fees. The analysis and release of these materials will contribute significantly to public understanding of water affordability issues in the tri-county area.

I will expect a response within 5 business days as provided by law. If my request is denied in whole or in part, I expect a detailed justification for withholding the records. I also request any segregable portions that are not exempt to be disclosed.

If you have any questions or suggestions for reducing the burden of my request, please reach out and we are happy to discuss.

Sincerely,
People's Water Board Coalition

communications.communication:

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Greta Moran

communications.subject: NC Dept of Labor Public Records Request
communications.communication:
Greta Moran
MuckRock News, DEPT MR131353
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, Massachusetts. 02115
131353-61094228@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:131353-61094228@requests.muckrock.com>

Ms. Moran,
You submitted a public records request to the NC Department of Labor on 07/13/2022 regarding Occupational Safety and Health inspections performed on Lorillard, Inc., Alliance One International., Reynolds American Inc., Liggett Vector Brands LLC, and Imperial Tobacco PLC.
It is my understanding that you have been provided the OSH inspection information from PSIM, but an additional part of your requests was "all of the agency's e-mail correspondences with any of the follow tobacco companies, Lorillard, Inc., Alliance One International., Reynolds American Inc., Liggett Vector Brands LLC. Imperial Tobacco PLC, between January 1, 2020 and present."  Based on what you have requested, I have to run email searches separate from the OSH inspection information because emails are maintained in a separate system. Due to the sensitive nature of emails, I am the only authorized person within the agency with all email access who may run such a search.
To date, I have attempted to run the requested company names in a myriad of ways, but because of the commonality of several words  (e.g., alliance, brands, tobacco) and your request for "all of the agency's email correspondence" (no specific NC Dept of Labor employee), I am getting thousands of emails that include those words; further, the search must be run through all 350+ NCDOL employees, so each search is taking several hours to run.  I then have to review the emails to see if the email is applicable to your request, such as only referring to "Alliance One International" instead of some other Alliance One reference.  I have continued to attempt to refine the searches, in an attempt to produce a more reasonable-sized list. Please be advised that based on my prior attempts, I must advise you that it will  take me extensive time to go through such information.
Is there a way you can refine your request or narrow the time frame?  Are there any specific NCDOL employees that may have been corresponding with these companies or are there specific email addresses within those named companies that I could use to refine the search?  Any information would be greatly appreciated.
Thank you.

Jill F. Cramer
General Counsel
NC Department of Labor
Direct: 919-707-7710
Main Legal Affairs: 919-707-7713

Mailing Address:
1101 Mail Service Center
Raleigh, NC   27699-1101
jill.cramer@labor.nc.gov<mailto:jill.cramer@labor.nc.gov>

Please visit our website at www.labor.nc.gov<http://www.nclabor.com/>

NOTICE:  E-mail correspondence to and from this sender may be subject to the North Carolina Public Records Law and may be disclosed to third parties.  This e-mail and all attachments transmitted with it may contain legally privileged and confidential information intended solely for the use of the addressee.  If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any reading, dissemination, distribution, copying, or other use of this message or its attachments is strictly prohibited.

If you have received this message in error, please notify the sender immediately by telephone  or by electronic mail, and delete this message.


________________________________

Email correspondence to and from this address may be subject to the North Carolina Public Records Law and may be disclosed to third parties by an authorized state official.

title: Written Correspondence Regarding The VCOEB Federal Asvosory Committee (05/01/2022 - Present) (Department of Veterans Affairs, Veterans Health Administration)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all written communications (including but not limited to emails) which were created, written, distributed, facsimiled and / or electronically transmitted between the dates of May 1st 2022 and one day before Responsive documents are provided to me in Response to this Request - regarding, whether directly or indirectly, the Veterans and Community Oversight and Engagement Board Federal Advisory Committee (aka VCOEB); wherein any one or more of the following persons are recipients, senders and / or distributors of said written correspondence:

Denis McDonough, Secretary of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs

Steven Braverman, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System Medical Center Director)

Robert Merchant, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System Executive Director)

Chihung Szeto, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Experience Office (often referred to as a VCOEB Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)

Eugene W. Skinner, U.S. Department
of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Defense Consultant, Federal Acquisitions Expert & Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)

Keith Harris, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Senior Executive Homelessness Agent for Greater Los Angeles)

Alan Trinh, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Contract Officer and Deputy Director)

Michael J. Missal, Inspector General of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs

Michael W. Fisher, an executive with the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Network Director of VISN 22)

Matthew MacGahran, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Chief of Community Engagement And Re-Integration Services)

Brett Simms, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as an Executive Director of the Office Of Asset Enterprise Management)

Jon J. Rychalski, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as the Chief Financial Officer of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs *even though he appears to have no Certified Public Account License)

Any and all U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Police Officers working at the West Los Angeles VA Soldiers Home aka VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System West Los Angeles VA Medical Center

I am technically qualified as a journalist.  My work is performed on an independent, unpaid volunteer basis.  This specific Request regarding recent written correspondence Records involving approximately 15 specified Public Officials within the specified period, pertaining to a Federal Advisory Committee Legislated under Public Law 114-226 and Chartered to "improve outcomes for homeless Veterans" is not made nor intended to be used for commercial purposes.  It does regard, among other things: a Public Service, Public Meetings, Open Sessions and matters related to a Federal Advisory Committee.

Additional background information regarding the VCOEB is provided to interested parties at the following links for educational and contextually informative purposes which may offer significant insights in support of the Lawful operation of Federal Advisory Committees operating in Our Nation's Capital of Veteran Homelessness:

https://www.instagram.com/reel/CiPiS97jIid/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/reel/ChqrwoNDt4H/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/p/CfKWzSev017/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/p/CiGkVwmvw3M/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/reel/Chr39g_j7qG/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/tv/CU-MvrhDuAI/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ryan Thompson

communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Thompson,


This letter acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) dated October 5, 2022, in which you requested:


  *   Copies of all written communications (including but not limited to emails) which were created, written, distributed, facsimiled and / or electronically transmitted between the dates of May 1, 2022, and one day before Responsive documents are provided to me in Response to this Request - regarding, whether directly or indirectly, the Veterans and Community Oversight and Engagement Board Federal Advisory Committee (aka VCOEB); wherein any one or more of the following persons are recipients, senders and / or distributors of said written correspondence:



  *   Denis McDonough, Secretary of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
  *   Steven Braverman, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System Medical Center Director)
  *   Robert Merchant, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System Executive Director)
  *   Chihung Szeto, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Experience Office (often referred to as a VCOEB Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)
  *   Eugene W. Skinner, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Defense Consultant, Federal Acquisitions Expert & Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)
  *   Keith Harris, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Senior Executive Homelessness Agent for Greater Los Angeles)
  *   Alan Trinh, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Contract Officer and Deputy Director)
  *   Michael J. Missal, Inspector General of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
  *   Michael W. Fisher, an executive with the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Network Director of VISN 22)
  *   Matthew MacGahran, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Chief of Community Engagement and Re-Integration Services)
  *   Brett Simms, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as an Executive Director of the Office of Asset Enterprise Management)
  *   Jon J. Rychalski, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as the Chief Financial Officer of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs *even though he appears to have no Certified Public Account License)



  *   Any and all U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Police Officers working at the West Los Angeles VA Soldiers Home aka VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System West Los Angeles VA Medical Center




The FOIA Service received your request on October 18, 2022, and assigned it FOIA tracking numbers 23-00135-F; 23-00499-F; 23-00566-F; 23-00567-F; 23-00568-F; 23-00569-F; and 23-00570-F.  Please refer to these numbers when communicating with the VA about this request.


The records you requested, if they exist, are maintained at the Office of the Secretary (OSVA); Office of Assistant Secretary for Management (MGMT); Veterans Experience Office (VEO); Office of Asset Enterprise Management (OAEM); VISN 22 - Desert Pacific Health Care Network (HCN); Veterans Health Administration (VHA), VA Greater Los Angeles Health Care System (HCS) and the Office of Inspection General (OIG).  Therefore, we are redirecting your request to these offices for a file search and a direct response to you. OIG has its own tracking number.  You will be notified by them of its FOIA tracking number.  If you wish to know the status of your request, please contact them directly at the following addresses:

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Written Correspondence Regarding The VCOEB Federal Asvosory Committee (05/01/2022 - Present) (Department of Veterans Affairs, Veterans Health Administration)
communications.communication:
Veterans Health Administration:

Please review the attached and urgent folowup and response to your improper attempt to close this Request without satisfactory Response.  The attached file is named RT-VHA_FOIA_11222022_R1.pdf

For your and the Public's convenience, text of the body of the attached Letter portion of the aforementioned, urgent followup - follows below.  Note the attachement must be reviewed to review the cited Appendices.

____________________________________________________________________

November 22nd, 2022


TO:

U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
Veterans Health Administration
Office of the Inspector General
Washington DC, USA


CC:

Denis McDonough, Secretary of the U.S Department of Veterans Affairs
Michael J. Missal, Inspector General of the U.S Department of Veterans Affairs
Luis-Vasquez Contes, American GI Forum National Commander
Lawrence Romo, American GI Forum National Legislative Director
Esau Herrera, American GI Forum CA State Commander
Francisco Juarez, American GI Forum El Camino Real Chapter Legislative Officer 
Richard Southern, Vietnam Veterans of America National Board Member
Sennet Devermont, Always For The People
Cable News Network
Mirror Media Group
Muckrock News


RE:

Followup on 10/05/0222 US DVA VHA FOIA Request (Ryan Thompson)
US DVA FOIA Tracking Numbers include: 23-00135-F, 23-00499-F, 23-00566-F,
23-00567-F, 23-00568-F, 23-00569-F, 23-00570-F & 23-00006-FOIA


VIA:  Muckrock News & E-Mail


U.S Department of Veterans Affairs VHA, OIG & Related FOIA Staff:


On 10/05/2022, I submitted an FOIA Request to the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Health Administration; regarding copies of written communications by, as well as received by; specified U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Officials between 05/01/2022 and Present - about the Veterans And Community Oversight And Engagement Board (VCOEB) Federal Advisory Committee that's Chartered under the Federal Advisory Committee Act, Mandated by Public Law 114-226 as well as regulated by the Administrative Procedures Act.  A copy of the Request is attached to this Letter as "Appendix A".

On 10/20/2022, the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Health Administration (VHA) Acknowledged receiving my FOIA Request on 10/18/2022 and reported the following Tracking Numbers for it: 23-00135-F, 23-00499-F, 23-00566-F, 23-00567-F, 23-00568-F, 23-00569-F, 23-00570-F.  Veterans Health Administration stated in that Acknowledgement that the Requested Records, if they exist, will be maintained by Veterans Health Administration; as well as other divisions of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, including the VA Office of the Inspector General, all of which VHA is coordinating with to satisfy the Request.  A copy of VHA's 10/20/2022 Acknowledgement is attached to this Letter within "Appendix A".

On 11/17/2022, I received an "Agency Final Response" to my FOIA Request from Government Information Specialist Barya Offer, on behalf of the Office of the Inspector General for the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.  The sum of Offer's purported "Agency Final Response" is, "please see the Agency Final Response regarding your request"; with an attached PDF file named "Agency Final Response No Records - Full Denial.pdf".  Said file is a letter from Supervisory Government Information Specialist Ruthhee G. Bellamy of the VA OIG Release Information Office - notifying me that VA OIG assigned Tracking Number 23-00006-FOIA to my Request, among other things.  A copy of VHA's 11/17/2022 "Agency Final Response" is included in the "Appendix A" attachment to this Letter.

The "Agency Final Response No Records - Full Denial" letter from VA OIG on 11/17/2022 is attached to this Letter as "Appendix B"; and declares "we were unable to locate any responsive records pertaining to your request"; yet only as the Request pertains to Inspector General Michael J. Missal in VA OIG Records.  Unfortunately, VA OIG's Response to my Request is a false statement of fact; provable by one of many Records in my possession which would have to be included in any satisfactory Response to my Request, notwithstanding whether that Response is from VA OIG, VHA or otherwise applicable officse / divisions of US DVA.

The aforementioned Record in my possession is an e-mail I sent to Inspector General Missal and others on 05/27/2022 regarding VCOEB, that a simple search for the text "VCOEB" will produce upon querying Inspector General Missal's e-mail correspondence between 05/01/2022 and Present.  Given that e-mail was not returned to sender and Inspector General Missal directly corresponded with me several times in the recent past from the same e-mail address; and because information about a Federal Advisory Committee that holds Public Meetings in Open Session on Public land for Public attendance (as Publicly Noticed in the Federal Register), is not qualified to be suppressed due limited National Security provisions under 5 U.S.C. Statutes governing FOIA - apparently the minimum effort to satisfactorily Respond to my Request is beyond some U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Officials' intent to perform...  Despite VA OIG's purported "Agency Final Response No Records - Full Denial" Letter probably cost Federal Taxpayer's far more to produce than performing the simple searches to lawfully satisfy and Respond to my Request will; presuming Public Records required to satisfy my Request were not unlawfully tampered with. Even in that hypothetical scenario though, the Records are obtainable from one of many archives US DVA is Mandated to retain as National Security against the tampering or loss of such Records.  A copy of my aforementioned 05/27/2022 e-mail to Inspector General Missal and one of many e-mails Inspector General Missal sent me from the same address he received my 05/27/2020 e-mail at, are attached to this Letter as "Appendix C".
Notwithstanding the validity or lack thereof in VA OIG's Response to a portion of my Request through VHA, the partial Response is not a legitimate, full Response to my Request; despite it being uncannily misrepresented as such by false statements of fact.

The Agency is at least procedurally failing to Respond to my Request on time in accordance with Federal Public Law.  I reassure you the Requested Records regarding a Federal Advisory Committee with a Public Law Mandate and Charter to improve outcomes for Veterans via Public Meetings held in Open Session here in Our Nation's Capital of Veteran Homelessness - are delays of Public Records offering a direct positive impact on disabled homeless Veterans' probability of survival and General Welfare of U.S. Taxpayers  Contrarily, the ongoing and baseless delays Responding to my Request are negatively impacting disabled homeless Veterans and Federal Taxpayers, until and unless the Request is fully and legitimately Responded to.

Given my maintained Good Faith in the majority of Our U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Staff's Public Integrity and capacity to ethically perform their duties in accordance with the Department's true Mission - I expect nothing less than the People of the United States of America do in this matter; a swift, comprehensive, accurate and satisfactory Response to my Request in accordance with Our Rights, Public Laws and increasing expenditures to expect no less of Our U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs' performance in respect thereof.

I declare under under penalty of perjury that the foregoing is true and correct.  Executed on November 22nd, 2022 in Los Angeles, California by:



Ryan Thompson


Independent Volunteer Civil Rights Advocate & Reporter
Member, American GI Forum Congressionally Chartered VSO
NHDVS.net
rt@nhdvs.net

C/o Muckrock News
DEPT MR 103928
263 Huntington Avenue
Boston, MA 02115

title: Phoenix Police Social Media Settings

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Phoenix Police Social Media Settings
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

With respect to any Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram account created, operated, or maintained by your agency:

1. A copy of the list of people, accounts, or pages banned by that account. This list is accessible by logging into the account as an administrator and:
(a) On Facebook, clicking "Settings" t the top of the official page, (C) clicking “People and Other Pages” in the left column, and (D) selecting “Banned People and Pages” from the drop-down menu. The final URL should look like: https://www.facebook.com/.../settings/?tab=people_and_other_pages. 
(b) On Twitter, navigating to this URL while logged into the account: https://twitter.com/settings/blocked.
(c) On Instagram, follow these instructions: https://help.instagram.com/461525818338125/?helpref=uf_share.

2. A copy of the settings for the Facebook page. This list is accessible by (A) logging into the Facebook page as an administrator, and then (B) clicking “Settings” at the top of the official page. The URL should look like: https://www.facebook.com/.../settings/?tab=settings. 

3. A copy of any policy concerning employee use of social media or use of your agency's social media accounts by the public.

These requests include, but are not limited to, the Facebook pages located at https://www.facebook.com/PhoenixPolice, the Twitter account @PhoenixPolice, and the Instagram account located at https://www.instagram.com/phoenixpolice.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request #PR2022384673
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I would like to amend my public records request to more specifically seek the following records. An example of what each of these records look like is attached and available at https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/21579793-facebook-and-twitter-settings-examples.

With respect to any Twitter or Facebook account created, operated, or maintained by your agency:

1. A copy of the full settings for the Facebook page. These records may be accessed through one of three processes:
The first option:
(a) Log in as an administrator of the page.
(b) Navigate to the Facebook page (e.g., https://www.facebook.com/PhoenixPolice).
(c) On the lefthand side of the page, where it says "Manage Page," scroll to "Settings," located at the lefthand side of the bottom of the page.
(d) Click "General" on the lefthand side of the page.

The second option:
(a) Log in as an administrator of the page.
(b) Go to the following URL, replacing "PhoenixPolice" with the appropriate page name: https://www.facebook.com/PhoenixPolice/settings/?tab=settings.

The third option:
(a) Log in as an administrator of the page.
(b) Navigate to the Facebook page (e.g., https://www.facebook.com/PhoenixPolice).
(c) Go to this URL, replacing "PhoenixPolice" with the appropriate page name: https://www.facebook.com/PhoenixPolice/settings/?tab=settings&ref=page_edit&section=download_your_page
(d) Click "Download your page"
(e) Select "HTML," "High," and "All time" in the available options.
(f) Make sure only the "Page profile information" and "Page settings" boxes are checked.
(g) Click "Request a download."
(h) When the information is ready to download, enter the password to download it.
(i) Press "confirm."
(j) Provide the files contained in the .zip file.

2. A copy of the list of banned people and pages. This record may be accessed in this manner:
(a) Log in as an administrator of the page.
(b) Navigate to the Facebook page (e.g., https://www.facebook.com/PhoenixPolice).
(c) On the lefthand side of the page, where it says "Manage Page," scroll to "Settings," located at the lefthand side of the bottom of the page.
(d) Click "People and other Pages" on the lefthand side of the page.
(e) On the menu labeled "People who Like this Page," select "Banned People and Pages"

3. A copy of the list of "Page Roles." This record may be accessed in this manner:
(a) Log in as an administrator of the page.
(b) Navigate to the Facebook page (e.g., https://www.facebook.com/PhoenixPolice).
(c) On the lefthand side of the page, where it says "Manage Page," scroll to "Settings," located at the lefthand side of the bottom of the page.
(d) Click "Page Roles" on the lefthand side of the page.

5. A copy of the lists of users blocked by the Twitter account. This list can be obtained through this process:
(a) Log into the account.
(b) Visit this URL: https://twitter.com/settings/blocked/all
(c) Visit this URL: https://twitter.com/settings/blocked/imported

Thank you!

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Technical Support Submission on 10/6/2022 PPD:0357001
communications.communication:
Hello Adam Steinbaugh ,


In regards to the technical support submission on 10/6/2022, your portal account has not yet been created.  Please create an account using your account email address 125705-21113000@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:125705-21113000@requests.muckrock.com> by following the steps below or in the attached document:


  1.  CLICK HERE<https://phxpublicsafety.dynamics365portals.us/> to access the Police Public Records portal. Be sure to use a Chrome or Edge browser.
  2.  Click on the Submit Requests button in the center of the webpage
  3.  Click on the Sign Up Now link
  4.  You must first enter your email address and then click on Send Verification Code
  5.  Once you receive your verification code to the email address provided fill in the Verification Code field
  6.  Click on the Verify Code button
  7.  Enter a New Password (you must have a capital letter, number, and special character)
  8.  Confirm the New Password
  9.  Enter your Surname
  10. Enter your Given Name
  11. Click on the Create button to complete your account
  12. Once your account is completed you will be redirected to the Police Public Records portal home page



If you would like to speak with someone for assistance with your request please call 602-534-1127.

If you would like to schedule an over-the-phone or lobby appointment please call 602-262-1885 or send an email to policerecords.appts@phoenix.gov.

If you experience any further issues please CLICK HERE<https://www.phoenix.gov/police/contact-police/public-records-technical-support> to submit a technical support ticket.



Thank you,

Phoenix Police Department
Public Records and Services Unit
1717 E Grant St Suite 100
Phoenix, AZ 85034
(602) 534-1127
Monday-Friday 8am to 4pm

title: Automated License Plate Readers (Stanislaus County Sheriff's Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Automated License Plate Readers (Stanislaus County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
Dear Custodian of Records:

This letter constitutes a request under the California Public Records Act ("CPRA") from the Electronic Frontier Foundation, submitted with the assistance of MuckRock News. 

We request the following records related to Automated License Plate Readers ("ALPRs") and your law enforcement agency ("Agency").

Part A - Information related to ALPR data sharing.

A1. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data;
A2. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data;
A3. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information;
A4. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information.
The information requested in items A1-A4 is readily available for extraction through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Data Sharing Report function. With Flock Safety, this information is available through the transparency portal function. Other software, such as BOSS, has similar functionality.  

Most agencies have encountered little difficulty in providing this information (see below). In a small number of cases, an agency has interpreted items A1-A4 as requesting the creation of a record that does not exist. We disagree: this data is maintained by your software, can be exported through software your agency has already purchased, and is therefore subject to CPRA. 

However, should you disagree, you may alternatively produce the following records:  

A5. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents that external agencies have signed to comply with Sec 1798.90.52(b) for accessing your agency's ALPR data. These documents are also often required under the "Releasing ALPR Data" subsection of a California law enforcement agency's SB 34 policy. 
A6. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents  that your agency has signed pursuant to Sec 1798.90.52(b) to access other agencies' ALPR data.
A7. All "records of access" required by Sec. 1798.90.52(a) for the periods January 1, 2021 until the date of processing this request. 

Items A5-A7 are not necessary if your agency provides the information requested in items A1-A4. We feel that items A1-A4 are more focused and would require less labor from your agency to produce. 

Part B - Information Related to Numbers of “Detections” (plate scans) and “Hits” (plate scans that matched to a hotlist)

B1. The aggregate number of "detections" collected during 2021.
B2.  The aggregate number of “hits” during 2021.
B3. The aggregate number of "detections" from January 1, 2022 until the date this request is processed. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. For example, most Flock Safety systems may not have this data beyond 30 days. 
B4.  The aggregate number of “hits” from January 1, 2022 until the date this request is processed. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period.

The information requested in items B1-B4 is readily available through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Hit Ratio Report function. With Flock Safety, this information  is available through the transparency portal function. Other software, such as BOSS, has similar functionality.  As noted above, this information exists within your system and can be easily exported with existing software.

Part C - Assistance, Description, and Recommendations. 

We make the following requests under section 6253.1 of the California Public Records Act

C1. A description of  the information technology and physical location in which the records exist.
C2. Assist us identifying records and information that will help the public understand how ALPR data and hotlists are shared, how much data is collected year-to-year, and how much of that data matches a hot list; and 
C3. Provide suggestions for overcoming any practical basis for denying access to the information sought.

Please note that more than 80 California law enforcement agencies have provided the information requested in Parts A1-A4 and B1-B4 in previous years. For your reference we have included a list below with the names of the agencies that have historically provided these records.

CPRA requires you to undertake reasonable efforts to locate responsive records and to work in good faith with requesters to respond to their request. See CYAC v. City of National City, 220 Cal.App.4th 1385, 1430 (2013). Thus under the CPRA you are obligated to conduct a reasonable search and cannot deny a request merely because it might generate a large volume of records. 

We ask that you please respond to this request within 10 days either by providing all the requested records or by providing a written response setting forth the legal authority on which you rely in withholding or redacting any document, as well as stating when documents will be made available. Should you choose to withhold or reject this request, we ask that you provide an explanation of why your agency is responding differently compared to the many others that have complied with our request. 

We also request that any records maintained in an electronic format be provided in that same format (such as a PDF, CSV or XLS file), to avoid copying costs.

However, should you be unable to do so, EFF will reimburse you for the direct costs of copying these records (if you elect to charge for copying) plus postage. If you anticipate that these costs will exceed $25.00, or that the time needed to copy the records will delay their release, please contact me so that I can arrange to inspect the documents or decide which documents I wish to have copied. Please also provide an invoice and a cost breakdown of the fee estimate. If the fees are less than $25.00, please copy and send the records and invoice as soon as possible, and we will promptly pay the required costs.

title: Automated License Plate Readers (San Rafael Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Automated License Plate Readers (San Rafael Police Department)
communications.communication:
Dear Custodian of Records:

This letter constitutes a request under the California Public Records Act ("CPRA") from the Electronic Frontier Foundation, submitted with the assistance of MuckRock News. 

We request the following records related to Automated License Plate Readers ("ALPRs") and your law enforcement agency ("Agency").

Part A - Information related to ALPR data sharing.

A1. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data;
A2. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data;
A3. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information;
A4. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information.
The information requested in items A1-A4 is readily available for extraction through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Data Sharing Report function. With Flock Safety, this information is available through the transparency portal function. Other software, such as BOSS, has similar functionality.  

Most agencies have encountered little difficulty in providing this information (see below). In a small number of cases, an agency has interpreted items A1-A4 as requesting the creation of a record that does not exist. We disagree: this data is maintained by your software, can be exported through software your agency has already purchased, and is therefore subject to CPRA. 

However, should you disagree, you may alternatively produce the following records:  

A5. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents that external agencies have signed to comply with Sec 1798.90.52(b) for accessing your agency's ALPR data. These documents are also often required under the "Releasing ALPR Data" subsection of a California law enforcement agency's SB 34 policy. 
A6. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents  that your agency has signed pursuant to Sec 1798.90.52(b) to access other agencies' ALPR data.
A7. All "records of access" required by Sec. 1798.90.52(a) for the periods January 1, 2021 until the date of processing this request. 

Items A5-A7 are not necessary if your agency provides the information requested in items A1-A4. We feel that items A1-A4 are more focused and would require less labor from your agency to produce. 

Part B - Information Related to Numbers of “Detections” (plate scans) and “Hits” (plate scans that matched to a hotlist)

B1. The aggregate number of "detections" collected during 2021.
B2.  The aggregate number of “hits” during 2021.
B3. The aggregate number of "detections" from January 1, 2022 until the date this request is processed. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. For example, most Flock Safety systems may not have this data beyond 30 days. 
B4.  The aggregate number of “hits” from January 1, 2022 until the date this request is processed. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period.

The information requested in items B1-B4 is readily available through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Hit Ratio Report function. With Flock Safety, this information  is available through the transparency portal function. Other software, such as BOSS, has similar functionality.  As noted above, this information exists within your system and can be easily exported with existing software.

Part C - Assistance, Description, and Recommendations. 

We make the following requests under section 6253.1 of the California Public Records Act

C1. A description of  the information technology and physical location in which the records exist.
C2. Assist us identifying records and information that will help the public understand how ALPR data and hotlists are shared, how much data is collected year-to-year, and how much of that data matches a hot list; and 
C3. Provide suggestions for overcoming any practical basis for denying access to the information sought.

Please note that more than 80 California law enforcement agencies have provided the information requested in Parts A1-A4 and B1-B4 in previous years. For your reference we have included a list below with the names of the agencies that have historically provided these records. 

American Canyon Police Department

Dave Maass

title: FOIA - Gurnee PD (IL) - Flock Safety Documents

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA - Gurnee PD (IL) - Flock Safety Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to Flock Safety (https://www.flocksafety.com) license-plate-reader hardware and/or software. Documents being requested here should include - but are not limited to - the following:

- Invoices, receipts, and/or requests for the purchase of any Flock Safety product/service
- MOUs from Flock Safety
- Brochures or product/service specifications regarding Flock Safety
- Privacy and/or data retention policies regarding Flock Safety product/services
- Any/all manuals regarding Flock Safety product/services
- Guidelines mentioning Flock Safety product/services
- Bulletins mentioning Flock Safety product/services
- Briefings mentioning Flock Safety product/services
- Use policies and standard operating procedures for Flock Safety product/services
- All emails sent (through this year) mentioning "Flock Safety" and/or "ALPR"
- Any/all digitally disseminated publications from your agency mentioning Flock Safety product/services

I am confident there are documents relevant to this request based on public literature and broadcast news video describing the use of the company's products by your agency: https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/crime/gurnee-police-and-gurnee-mills-set-up-license-plate-reading-camera-to-combat-crime-at-the-mall/ar-AA14ldlJ

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.subject: Police Department Public Request :: P008937-112822
communications.communication:
Thank you for your interest in public records from the Village of Gurnee IL.  Your request was received in this office on 11/28/2022 and given the reference number P008937-112822 for tracking purposes.  - Invoices, receipts, and/or requests for the purchase of any Flock Safety product/service- MOUs from Flock Safety- Brochures or product/service specifications regarding Flock Safety- Privacy and/or data retention policies regarding Flock Safety product/services- Any/all manuals regarding Flock Safety product/services- Guidelines mentioning Flock Safety product/services- Bulletins mentioning Flock Safety product/services- Briefings mentioning Flock Safety product/services- Use policies and standard operating procedures for Flock Safety product/services- All emails sent (through this year) mentioning "Flock Safety" and/or "ALPR"- Any/all digitally disseminated publications from your agency mentioning Flock Safety product/services
I am confident there are documents relevant to this request based on public literature and broadcast news video describing the use of the company's products by your agency: https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/crime/gurnee-police-and-gurnee-mills-set-up-license-plate-reading-camera-to-combat-crime-at-the-mall/ar-AA14ldlJ
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.
Sincerely,
J Ader 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant person(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request.  You will be contacted about the availability, possible associated fees, and provided with copies of the records requested.
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Request Center. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HYDYJfZosgtm-2FhRCtOct0BOXpF6rWeqdbiOZVhI3MEX7iEM2eTJUenrLPJJBf6OWpmwQQzgsicL-2BwailzHuJxJBnWEHTpa15uONilqyYdWUM5hOlwP2AqinZenOxDmsdJw-3D-3DRDDE_i-2FyY91cTnPN4-2FXfqA-2BWKwnYIPwJ0j4lH1mdZtuPadqu2jaXYvo1YIEjTFX5Xr-2F6HLxS57W73SUbhRQR7XHrWVbhj2m27HLSPxW-2FYO3B1Qby39NshyfGr80hJPFUI91iGhrOFNlhsdMNLbNEYXifJhU-2FN-2BLzjhVJuZp9EA-2Bs-2FknEQGRqy8Uug6eLOwg8Hh99fddI0sLP5P0A7zgmZLL2en7SBg-2F3NQ5Q9ya6SM1EgLWI-3D)

communications.subject: Gurnee Police FOIA Request P008937
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Mr. J Ader, 

The Gurnee Police Department is in receipt of the FOIA request that you
emailed to the Village of Gurnee last week that is asking for several
documents and items with the Flock Safety Program. 

You should have received an email from the GovQA platform welcoming you
and asking for you to complete your account, we will be using the GovQA
platform or portal to process your request, so upon its completion you
will receive emails and links for documents from there. The emails
should have come from an GURNEEIL Support gurneeil@govqa.com. 

The reason for today's email - which will also be sent via GovQA- is to
ask for more clarification and understanding on the line item of your
request stating "all emails sent (through this year) mentioning "Flock
Safety" and/or "ALPR". 

With the help of the Village of Gurnee's I.S. Division, a search has
started for emails and the initial findings have shown there are over
2600 emails that include "Flock Safety" or "ALPR". The amount of emails
located is a voluminous and unduly burdensome amount and the review will
not be able to be complete in the initial five day response for FOIA
processing. Due to this review and the impact on day to day operations,
I will be filing and extension for 5 additional business days. The
notice of extension is attached, you will also receive the extension
notice via GovQA. 

Additionally, it would be helpful if you narrowed the scope of your
request further by providing additional information sought so we can
assist you better in locating the information or responsive documents
that you are seeking. While it is the duty of the public body to respond
appropriately and produce materials, the public body can only do so when
the requester provides clear guidance on category of information
requested, especially when dealing with a classification of records that
is as voluminous as emails.

Feel free to respond via email, via GovQa messaging or call me
directly. I am in the office Monday- Friday from 7:30am to 4:00pm. I
will be happy to discuss over the phone or if you would like to leave me
a detailed message, you can. 

If you can respond in a timely manner, this will assist in completing
your request prior to the new responsive due date of 12/9/2022. 

Thank you
Heather Collins
FOIA Officer

 
Police Records Division 
Gurnee Police Department
100 N O’Plaine Rd, Gurnee IL 60031
P 847-599-7070
( tel:8475997050)  | F 847-599-7177
( tel:8472448678) 
policerecords@police.gurnee.il.us

Good afternoon Mr. J Ader, 
The Gurnee Police Department is in receipt of the FOIA request that you emailed to the Village of Gurnee last week that is asking for several documents and items with the Flock Safety Program. 
You should have received an email from the GovQA platform welcoming you and asking for you to complete your account, we will be using the GovQA platform or portal to process your request, so upon its completion you will receive emails and links for documents from there. The emails should have come from an GURNEEIL Support gurneeil@govqa.com. (mailto:gurneeil@govqa.com) 
The reason for today's email - which will also be sent via GovQA- is to ask for more clarification and understanding on the line item of your request stating "all emails sent (through this year) mentioning "Flock Safety" and/or "ALPR". 
With the help of the Village of Gurnee's I.S. Division, a search has started for emails and the initial findings have shown there are over 2600 emails that include "Flock Safety" or "ALPR". The amount of emails located is a voluminous and unduly burdensome amount and the review will not be able to be complete in the initial five day response for FOIA processing. Due to this review and the impact on day to day operations, I will be filing and extension for 5 additional business days. The notice of extension is attached, you will also receive the extension notice via GovQA. 
Additionally, it would be helpful if you narrowed the scope of your request further by providing additional information sought so we can assist you better in locating the information or responsive documents that you are seeking. While it is the duty of the public body to respond appropriately and produce materials, the public body can only do so when the requester provides clear guidance on category of information requested, especially when dealing with a classification of records that is as voluminous as emails. 
Feel free to respond via email, via GovQa messaging or call me directly. I am in the office Monday- Friday from 7:30am to 4:00pm. I will be happy to discuss over the phone or if you would like to leave me a detailed message, you can. 
If you can respond in a timely manner, this will assist in completing your request prior to the new responsive due date of 12/9/2022. 
Thank you 
Heather Collins 
FOIA Officer

communications.communication:
Heather Collins 
RE: Police Department Public Request created on November 28, 2022, Reference # P008937-112822 
 
Dear J Ader, 
 
The Village of Gurnee received a public records request from you on November 28, 2022. You requested the following: "- Invoices, receipts, and/or requests for the purchase of any Flock Safety product/service- MOUs from Flock Safety- Brochures or product/service specifications regarding Flock Safety- Privacy and/or data retention policies regarding Flock Safety product/services- Any/all manuals regarding Flock Safety product/services- Guidelines mentioning Flock Safety product/services- Bulletins mentioning Flock Safety product/services- Briefings mentioning Flock Safety product/services- Use policies and standard operating procedures for Flock Safety product/services- All emails sent (through this year) mentioning "Flock Safety" and/or "ALPR"- Any/all digitally disseminated publications from your agency mentioning Flock Safety product/services 
I am confident there are documents relevant to this request based on public literature and broadcast news video describing the use of the company's products by your agency: https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/crime/gurnee-police-and-gurnee-mills-set-up-license-plate-reading-camera-to-combat-crime-at-the-mall/ar-AA14ldlJ 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 
Sincerely, 
J Ader" 
In reference to your records request, I require additional time to respond. This is due to the unexpected large number of responsive records and based on the need to gather and determine whether any of the information requested is statutorily exempt from disclosure. 
Accordingly, I estimate that by 12/9/2022, we will complete the request. 
 
Thank you for your patience in awaiting this information. 
 
To view related files as they become available, please log into My Request Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HYDYJfZosgtm-2FhRCtOct0BMbeHlSGth-2F3BXRd3SLmZ3d42zd79tG0JYbvvPXCHicU6C8Jx0Kk3SqYEMSt37G0m4-3DF5MB_i-2FyY91cTnPN4-2FXfqA-2BWKwnYIPwJ0j4lH1mdZtuPadqu2jaXYvo1YIEjTFX5Xr-2F6HJfrl1j9qrLbVNPuSnXTpfieItxyqROgwZzfpMyLQy14jbvppRSL1WZ2DfMbgZlRurqqiVCCDh6B-2FWlTgh6cy5CqzN3ZLzRLxUciAOO58JeYfQ1vP7-2B3DDWWefYl-2BFlqpSoS-2BG6AcToxERulQMts8GI4DlNyjnJiJlh2crLnBPuM-3D)

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of November 28, 2022., Reference # P008937-112822. 
Dear J Ader, 
The Village of Gurnee Public Records Office received a public information request from you on November 28, 2022. Your request mentioned: "- Invoices, receipts, and/or requests for the purchase of any Flock Safety product/service- MOUs from Flock Safety- Brochures or product/service specifications regarding Flock Safety- Privacy and/or data retention policies regarding Flock Safety product/services- Any/all manuals regarding Flock Safety product/services- Guidelines mentioning Flock Safety product/services- Bulletins mentioning Flock Safety product/services- Briefings mentioning Flock Safety product/services- Use policies and standard operating procedures for Flock Safety product/services- All emails sent (through this year) mentioning "Flock Safety" and/or "ALPR"- Any/all digitally disseminated publications from your agency mentioning Flock Safety product/services 
I am confident there are documents relevant to this request based on public literature and broadcast news video describing the use of the company's products by your agency: https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/crime/gurnee-police-and-gurnee-mills-set-up-license-plate-reading-camera-to-combat-crime-at-the-mall/ar-AA14ldlJ 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 
Sincerely, 
J Ader"

You have the right to file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor of the Attorney General's Office of Illinois by submitting a written request to: 
Public Access Bureau

Springfield, IL 62706 publicaccess@atg.state.il.us or 877-299-FOIA (mailto:publicaccess@atg.state.il.us) The Request for Review must be submitted within 60 calendar days from the last response of the public body.  Your request must be in writing and include a copy of the FOIA response, along with your signature.  The Public Access Counselor has 60 calendar days to respond. You also have the right to seek judicial review by filing a lawsuit in the circuit court. 
Sincerely, 
Heather Collins

Police

title: Jail Grievances

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Jail Grievances
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Monthly reports to the Sheriff regarding inmate population as described in Marin County Sheriff’s Office Custody Manual Policy 500 Population Management, section 500.3 and 500.4 for the past 36 months.

I also request copies of Inmate Grievance Forms filed during the past 36 months as described in Marin County Sheriff’s Office Custody Manual Policy 609 Inmate Grievances redacted of personal identifying information and recorded as described in Policy 205 Inmate Records section 205.3. in the Corrections Management System (CMS).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Frank Shinneman

title: Alabama State Employees (2018 - 2022)

communications.subject: Alabama Public Records Request: Alabama State Employees (2018 - 2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Public Records, I hereby request the following records:

Monthly electronic listings of all employees of the Alabama Executive Branch from January 1, 2018 to July 31, 2022. Specifically, I am seeking electronic listings of all individuals employed within all state agencies, commissions, and departments for each month from January 1, 2018 to July 31, 2022.

For each month, I’m seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following fields for each employee: full legal name, unique employee identification code, date of birth or age, title, department or agency, race, gender, full-time/part-time status, location, hire date, termination date, civil service status (e.g., classified or unclassified), and gross annual salary. If you cannot produce any of these fields, please let me know and generate only the available variables.

If these data are not available at monthly intervals, please produce the datasets at the most frequent interval possible. For example, if the data is not available monthly, please produce the data at quarterly intervals.

In addition, please include any lookup tables that may be needed to interpret the data. For example, if departments are listed with codes linked to a separate table, I will be happy to join the records myself, rather than require your staff to do so.

I am comfortable working with large data sets and can receive the records in a variety of formats (.dbf, .csv, .mdb, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Ben Goehring.

communications.subject: RE: Alabama Public Records Request: Alabama State Employees (2018 - 2022)
communications.communication:
Mr. Natta,

We cannot fulfill your request because the State Personnel Department does not maintain the requested reports or lists in the normal course of business. Additionally, some of the requested information is the type of information that the Open Records Act specifically prohibits disclosure of as “Identifying Information.”

The only information that SPD keeps in the normal course of business that may be generally responsive to your request is the attached SPD Annual Reports. I will also note that the State of Alabama provides records of its expenditures for the time periods in your request, including salaries, on www.open.alabama.gov<http://www.open.alabama.gov>. This website is publicly available.

Please let me know if you have any questions regarding the above information.
Best regards,


 [cid:image001.jpg@01D90BC3.E4589880]
Blake E. Brookshire
General Counsel
State Personnel Department

Phone: (334) 353-0046
Fax: (334) 353-4481

Folsom Administrative Building
64 N. Union Street, Suite 316
Montgomery, AL 36130

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: Flower Mound PD Responses to Funimation/Crunchyroll Headquarters
communications.communication:
Good morning Joseph,

Our town attorneys had up to 10 business days to look over the responsive records. The 10th business day was yesterday, Tuesday, September 20th, 2022. They should’ve sent either an email to the email address provided or mail to the mailing address in your request.

If you have any further questions, feel free to give me a call.
Thanks!

Nayla Marquez
Digital Evidence & Records Technician
Flower Mound Police Department
4150 Kirkpatrick Ln.
Flower Mound, Tx 75028
Desk: 972-874-3378

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: Flower Mound PD Responses to Funimation/Crunchyroll Headquarters
communications.communication:
Hello,

I was unaware there would be information believed to be exempt from disclosure per Texas law. In that case, I shall wait for a ruling from Paxton. Is there any information that the office believes would not be exempt from disclosure per Texas law?

Thanks.

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: Flower Mound PD Responses to Funimation/Crunchyroll Headquarters
communications.communication:
Mr. Pasteris,

Under the requirements of the Public Information Act, I am legally required to send all confidential information contained in the documents you requested to the Attorney General’s Office for an official ruling that will determine what is able to be released to you. At this point, we are required to wait for a ruling from the Attorney General. You can expect a response from the Attorney General’s Office within the next 45 days. I am not able to provide you any additional information or legal advice.

Cara Leahy White
